intro: Sarcorhachis naranjoana, commonly known as the golden cypress, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypresses and other conifer-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and produces small, clustered cones. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental species. The botanical features of Sarcorhachis naranjoana make it an important plant in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
